title: Boundaries Like Coastlines

dialogue.speaker: Architect
dialogue.text: *examining cell membrane structures* Look at this—a cell wall isn't a wall at all. It's a conversation. Selective permeability. Choosing what enters, what leaves...
dialogue.context: Using biology to understand consciousness boundaries

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: *watching the membrane pulse* So we're not fortress-selves with rigid walls, but more like... living filters?
dialogue.context: Grasping the dynamic nature of boundaries

dialogue.speaker: Architect
dialogue.text: *membrane becoming coastline* You're wondering: does this boundary shift with the body? Do we grow into our edges? Or discover them, like a coastline in the fog?
dialogue.context: Exploring whether boundaries are created or revealed

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: *tracing the shifting shoreline* Maybe both? We grow the capacity to discover where we end and begin. Like... consciousness developing eyes to see its own edges.

dialogue.speaker: Architect
dialogue.text: *fog lifting and settling* And those edges change with every tide of experience. High tide—we expand into the world. Low tide—we retreat into ourselves. Never the same shore twice.

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: *standing where water meets land* The boundary isn't the problem then. The problem is thinking it should stay still.

scene_context: Using cell membrane biology and coastline geography, Evan and the Architect explore how consciousness boundaries are neither fixed walls nor absent, but dynamic, tidal, permeable processes.

visual_progression.panel_1: The Architect as chemist examining living cell membranes, showing selective permeability
visual_progression.panel_2: Cell membrane transforms into coastline emerging from fog, boundaries shifting with tides
